ProcedureOptionHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: MAPDATA=map-data-set
      
Specifies a data set that contains the coordinates for the boundary points of each map area drawn 
with a CHOROMAP statement. You can specify map data sets licensed by SAS from GfK GeoMarketing GmBH 
and converted by SAS to a SAS data set format. You must install the SAS/GRAPH component in order to 
have access to this MAPSGFK map library.

Syntax: PLOTDATA=plot-data-set
      
Specifies a data set that contains data for the plot overlay. You can specify map data sets licensed 
by SAS from GfK GeoMarketing GmBH and converted by SAS to a SAS data set format. You must install the 
SAS/GRAPH component in order to have access to this MAPSGFK map library.

Syntax: MAPRESPDATA=response-data-set
      
Identifies the data set that contains the response values for the polygonal map areas drawn with the 
CHOROMAP statement.

RestrictionThe SGMAP procedure prohibits specifying the map data set as the response data set.

Syntax: DESCRIPTION=“text-string”
      
specifies a description for the output. The description is used in the following locations:

  o the Results window
  o the alternate text for the image in HTML output
  o the table of contents that is created by the CONTENTS option in an ODS statement

The default description is “The SGMAP Procedure”.

Disables automatic legends from being generated. SAS 9.4M6: The NOAUTOLEGEND option overrides the 
default behavior. Specify this option on the SGMAP procedure statement.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: X= variable 
          
Specifies the variable for the X axis (longitude). The variable can have a character or numeric value.

Syntax: Y= variable 
          
Specifies the variable for the Y axis (latitude). The variable can have a character or numeric value.

Syntax: SIZE= numeric-variable
          
Specifies the variable that controls the size of the bubbles. The minimum and maximum 
values automatically provide the range that is used to determine bubble sizes. You can 
control this range manually by using the BRADIUSMAX and BRADIUSMIN options.

Syntax: BRADIUSMAX=n<units>
          
Specifies the size of the radius of the largest bubble. You can specify any positive number for n, 
including decimals, as the dimension of the size.

Syntax: BRADIUSMIN=n<units>
            
Specifies the size of the radius of the smallest bubble. You can specify any positive number for n, 
including decimals, as the dimension of the size.

Syntax: DATALABEL=variable
          
Displays a label for each data point. If you specify a variable, the values of that variable are used 
for the data labels. If you do not specify a variable, then no labels are displayed and an error message 
is issued in the SAS log. The position of the labels is automatically adjusted to prevent the labels from 
overlapping.

[Syntax: DATALABELATTRS=(option(s))
          
Specifies the appearance of the labels in the plot when you use the DATALABEL= option.

options can be one or more of the following: 

  COLOR= color 
    specifies the color of the label characters. You can specify colors using the same color schemes that 
    are supported by SAS/GRAPH software.  
    Default: For ungrouped data, the default color is specified by the Color attribute of the GraphDataText 
    style element in the current style. For grouped data, the default color is specified by the ContrastColor 
    attribute of the GraphData1 ... GraphDatan style elements in the current style. 
  FAMILY= "font-family" 
    pecifies the font family for the label characters. The SAS ODS styles use TrueType system fonts. 
    Default: The default font family is specified by the FontFamily attribute of the GraphDataText style element 
    in the current style. 
  SIZE= n <units> 
    specifies the font size of the label characters. You can also specify the unit of measurement. The default unit is pixels. 
    Default:The default font size is specified by the FontSize attribute of the GraphDataText style element in the current style. 
  STYLE= ITALIC | NORMAL 
    specifies whether the label characters are italic (ITALIC) or normal (NORMAL). 
    Default: The default font style is specified by the FontStyle attribute of the GraphDataText style element in the current style. 
  WEIGHT= BOLD | NORMAL 
    specifies whether the label characters are bold (BOLD) or normal (NORMAL). 
    Default: The default font weight is specified by the FontWeight attribute of the GraphDataText style element in the current style. 
  
Interaction:This option has no effect unless the DATALABEL option is also specified.

Syntax: DATALABELPOS= BOTTOM | CENTER | TOP | BOTTOMLEFT | LEFT | TOPLEFT | BOTTOMRIGHT | RIGHT | TOPRIGHT
          
Specifies the location of the data label with respect to the plot.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Places the data label at the bottom of the plot.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Places the data label at the center of the plot.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Places the data label at the top of the plot.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: Places the data label at the bottom left corner of the plot.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip5: Places the data label on the left side of the plot.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip6: Places the data label on the top left corner of the plot.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip7: Places the data label at the bottom right corner of the plot.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip8: Places the data label on the right side of the plot.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip9: Places the data label on the top right corner of the plot.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Specifies that the bubbles are filled. The FILL option shows the fill color.
          
Specifying FILL also hides the outlines.

This is the default.
Specifies that the bubbles are not filled. The NOFILL option hides the fill color.

Syntax:FILLATTRS=style-element <(options)> | (option(s))
          
Specifies the fill color and transparency. You can specify the appearance by using a style element 
or by specifying specific options. If you specify a style element, you can also specify options to 
override specific appearance attributes.

Syntax: GROUP=variable
          
Specifies a discrete variable that is used to group the data. SAS 9.4M6: The plot elements for each 
group value are automatically distinguished by different visual attributes. Each distinct group value 
is represented in the graph by a different bubble color. Bubble fill patterns are not changed across 
groups.

Syntax: LEGENDLABEL="text-string" 
          
Specifies the label that identifies the bubble plot in the legend. By default, the label for the 
Size variable is used for ungrouped data. 

Interaction: The LEGENDLABEL= option has no effect if you also specify the GROUP= option in the 
same plot statement.

Syntax: NAME= "text-string"
          
Assigns a name to a plot overlay. You can use the name to refer to this plot in other statements.

Specifies that missing values of the group variable are not included in the plot. 
          
Interaction:This option has no effect unless GROUP= is also specified.

Specifies whether the outlines of the bubbles are visible. The OUTLINE option shows the outlines.
 
Interaction: Specifying OUTLINE also hides the fill color.

Syntax: TRANSPARENCY=value
          
Specifies the degree of transparency for the plot. The transparency that you specify applies to all 
aspects of the plot statement. For example, you can specify the amount of transparency applied to any
displayed marker fills and marker outlines.

Default0.0
Range0 (completely opaque) to 1 (completely transparent)

Syntax: ID=variable
          
Specifies a variable in the MAPRESPDATA= data set that links to the polygons in the map data set.

Generates a separate response level (color and surface pattern) for each different 
value of the formatted response variable.

Syntax: MAPID=variable
          
Specifies a variable in the MAPDATA= data set that is used to draw the CHOROMAP polygons. The MAPID= 
option also links to the map response data set if a response variable is specified.

Syntax: NAME="text-string"
          
Assigns a name for the map. You can use the name to refer to this map in other statements.

Syntax: DENSITY=0 ...6 | LOW | MEDIUM | HIGH
          
For maps that have a DENSITY variable, specifies the density of map observations that are used. 
The value that you specify indicates the maximum value that the DENSITY variable can have for the 
observation to be displayed.

Default:DENSITY=6

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Only observations in the map data set whose DENSITY value is less than or equal to 1 are displayed.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Only observations in the map data set whose DENSITY value is less than or equal to 2 are displayed.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Only observations in the map data set whose DENSITY value is less than or equal to 3 are displayed.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: Only observations in the map data set whose DENSITY value is less than or equal to 4 are displayed.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip5: Only observations in the map data set whose DENSITY value is less than or equal to 5 are displayed.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip6: Displays all the observations in the map data set.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip7: Only observations in the map data set whose DENSITY value is less than or equal to 1 are displayed.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip8: Only observations in the map data set whose DENSITY value is less than or equal to 3 are displayed.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip9: Displays all the observations in the map data set.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: LEGENDLABEL="text-string" 
          
Specifies the label that identifies the bubble plot in the legend. By default, the label for the 
response variable is used for ungrouped data. 

Interaction: The LEGENDLABEL= option has no effect if you also specify the GROUP= option in the 
same plot statement.

[Syntax:  LINEATTRS=style-element (option(s))
          
Specifies the appearance of the polygon border line attributes.

(options) can be one or more of the following: 
  COLOR=style-reference | color
    specifies the color of the polygon border line. 
  PATTERN= line-pattern-name | line-pattern-number
    specifies the line pattern for the border line.
  THICKNESS= n <units> 
    specifies the thickness of the line. You can also specify the unit of measure (CM, IN, MM, PCT or %, PT, PX.

Syntax: TRANSPARENCY=value
          
Specifies the degree of transparency for the plot. The transparency that you specify applies to all 
aspects of the plot statement. For example, you can specify the amount of transparency applied to any 
displayed marker fills and marker outlines.

Default:0.0
Range:0 (completely opaque) to 1 (completely transparent)

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: ESRIMAP URL=‘map-service’;
      
Creates a map based on Esri maps.

Syntax: GRADLEGEND <"name"> </option(s)>;
      
Generates a continuous legend that maps the data range of a numeric response variable to a range 
of colors. You can use up to four GRADLEGEND statements in a procedure.

"name"
specifies the name of the plot that you want to include in the legend. The name that you specify 
must correspond to a value that you entered for the NAME= option in a plot statement. The name must 
be enclosed in quotation marks.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata: Specifies that borders are visible around the legend.
Specifies that no borders are visible around the legend.

Syntax: EXTRACTSCALE<=DEFAULT | SCIENTIFIC>
          
Extracts a scale factor from the tick values and uses it to reduce the tick value width. The scale used 
is appended to the legend title as shown in the following example. 

  Total Sales (millions)

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Extracts a named scale. A named scale can be millions, billions, or trillions for values of 999 trillion  or less, or a multiple of 10 (denoted as 10^n) for values over 999 trillion. For small fractional tick  values, the scale factor is set to ensure that the absolute value of the smallest value is greater than 1.  The scale can be millionth, billionth, or trillionth for values of 1 trillionth or more, or a multiple  of 1/10 (10^–n) for values less than 1 trillionth.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Extracts a scientific-notation scale. A scientific-notation scale is a multiple of 10 expressed as 10^n  for values greater than 1, or a multiple of 1/10 expressed as 10^–n for values less than 1.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata: Specifies that integers are used for the gradient legend.

Syntax: POSITION=TOP | BOTTOM | LEFT | RIGHT 
          
Specifies the position of the legend within the graph.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Places the legend at the bottom of the graph.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Places the legend at the left side of the graph.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Places the legend at the right side of the graph.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: Places the legend at the top of the graph.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: TITLE= "text-string" 
          
Specifies a title for the legend.

[Syntax: TITLEATTRS=style-element | style-element <(option(s))> | (option(s))
          
Specifies the appearance of the title.

(options) can be one or more of the following: 
COLOR= color 
  specifies the color of the title characters. You can specify colors using the same color schemes 
  that are supported by SAS/GRAPH software.
FAMILY= "font-family" 
  specifies the font family for the title characters. The SAS ODS styles use TrueType system fonts. 
SIZE= n <units> 
  specifies the font size of the title characters. You can also specify the unit of measurement. 
  The default unit is pixels.
STYLE= ITALIC | NORMAL 
  specifies whether the title characters are italic or normal.
WEIGHT= BOLD | NORMAL 
  specifies whether the title characters are bold or normal. 
  
Default: The default appearance of the title text is specified by the GraphLabelText style element 
in the current style.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: KEYLEGEND <"name-1" ... "name-n"> </ option(s)>; 
      
Adds a legend to the plot.

“name-1” ... “name-n”
specifies the names of one or more plots that you want to include in the legend. Each name that 
you specify must correspond to a value that you entered for the NAME= option in a plot statement. 
Each name must be enclosed in quotation marks. If more than one name is specified, separate each 
by a space.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: TITLE= "text-string" 
          
Specifies a title for the legend.

Syntax: TITLEATTRS=style-element | style-element <(option(s))> | (option(s))
          
Specifies the appearance of the title.

options can be one or more of the following: 
COLOR= color 
  specifies the color of the title characters. You can specify colors using the same color schemes 
  that are supported by SAS/GRAPH software.
FAMILY= "font-family" 
  specifies the font family for the title characters. The SAS ODS styles use TrueType system fonts. 
SIZE= n <units> 
  specifies the font size of the title characters. You can also specify the unit of measurement. 
  The default unit is pixels.
STYLE= ITALIC | NORMAL 
  specifies whether the title characters are italic or normal.
WEIGHT= BOLD | NORMAL 
  specifies whether the title characters are bold or normal. 
  
Default: The default appearance of the title text is specified by the GraphLabelText style element 
in the current style.

Syntax: VALUEATTRS=style-element <(options)> | (options)
          
Specifies the appearance of the legend value labels. You can specify the appearance by using 
a style element or by specifying specific options. If you specify a style element, you can also 
specify options to override specific appearance attributes.

(options) can be one or more of the following: 
COLOR= color 
  specifies the color of the label characters. You can specify colors using the same color schemes 
  that are supported by SAS/GRAPH software.
FAMILY= "font-family" 
  specifies the font family for the label characters. The SAS ODS styles use TrueType system fonts.
SIZE= n <units> 
  specifies the font size of the label characters. You can also specify the unit of measurement. 
  The default unit is pixels.
STYLE= ITALIC | NORMAL 
  specifies whether the label characters are italic or normal.
WEIGHT= BOLD | NORMAL 
  specifies whether the label characters are bold or normal.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: OPENSTREETMAP;
      
Creates a map based on OpenStreetMap (OSM).

Syntax: SCATTER X= variable Y= variable < / option(s)>;  
      
Creates a scatter plot.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: X= numeric-variable 
          
Specifies the variable for the X axis.

Syntax: Y= numeric-variable
          
Specifies the variable for the Y axis.

Syntax: DATALABEL = variable 
          
Displays a label for each data point. If you specify a variable, the values of that variable are used 
for the data labels. If you do not specify a variable, then no labels are displayed and an error message 
is issued in the SAS log. The position of the labels is automatically adjusted to prevent the labels from 
overlapping.

Syntax: DATALABELATTRS=option(s))
          
Specifies the appearance of the labels in the plot when you use the DATALABEL= option.

(options) can be one or more of the following: 

  COLOR= color 
    specifies the color of the label characters. You can specify colors using the same color schemes that 
    are supported by SAS/GRAPH software.  
    Default: For ungrouped data, the default color is specified by the Color attribute of the GraphDataText 
    style element in the current style. For grouped data, the default color is specified by the ContrastColor 
    attribute of the GraphData1 ... GraphDatan style elements in the current style. 
  FAMILY= "font-family" 
    pecifies the font family for the label characters. The SAS ODS styles use TrueType system fonts. 
    Default: The default font family is specified by the FontFamily attribute of the GraphDataText style element 
    in the current style. 
  SIZE= n <units> 
    specifies the font size of the label characters. You can also specify the unit of measurement. The default unit is pixels. 
    Default:The default font size is specified by the FontSize attribute of the GraphDataText style element in the current style. 
  STYLE= ITALIC | NORMAL 
    specifies whether the label characters are italic (ITALIC) or normal (NORMAL). 
    Default: The default font style is specified by the FontStyle attribute of the GraphDataText style element in the current style. 
  WEIGHT= BOLD | NORMAL 
    specifies whether the label characters are bold (BOLD) or normal (NORMAL). 
    Default: The default font weight is specified by the FontWeight attribute of the GraphDataText style element in the current style. 
  
Interaction:This option has no effect unless the DATALABEL option is also specified.

Syntax: DATALABELPOS= BOTTOM | CENTER | TOP | BOTTOMLEFT | LEFT | TOPLEFT | BOTTOMRIGHT | RIGHT | TOPRIGHT
          
Specifies the location of the data label with respect to the plot. 

Interactions: This option has no effect unless you also specify the DATALABEL option.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Places the data label at the bottom of the plot.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Places the data label at the center of the plot.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Places the data label at the top of the plot.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: Places the data label at the bottom left corner of the plot.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip5: Places the data label on the left side of the plot.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip6: Places the data label on the top left corner of the plot.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip7: Places the data label at the bottom right corner of the plot.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip8: Places the data label on the right side of the plot.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip9: Places the data label on the top right corner of the plot.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: GROUP= variable
          
Specifies a variable that is used to group the data. The plot elements for each group value 
are automatically distinguished by different visual attributes. Each distinct group value is 
represented in the graph by a different marker color. Marker fill patterns are not changed 
across groups.

Syntax: LEGENDLABEL= "text-string" 
          
Specifies a label that identifies the markers from the plot in the legend. By default, 
the label of the Y variable is used.

Syntax: MARKERATTRS= style-element <(options)>| (options)
          
Specifies the appearance of the markers in the plot. You can specify the appearance by using a style 
element or by specifying specific options. If you specify a style element, you can also specify 
options to override specific appearance attributes.
          
options can be one or more of the following:

    COLOR= color 
    specifies the color of the markers.

    SIZE= n 
    specifies the size of the markers in pixels.

    SYMBOL= symbol-name 
    specifies the symbol for the markers.

Syntax: NAME= "text-string" 
          
Assigns a name to a plot overlay. You can use the name to refer to this plot in other statements.

Note: The text-string is case-sensitive and must define a unique name within the procedure. When you 
refer to this specified name in other statements within the SGMAP procedure, you must use the identical 
name.
Specifies that missing values of the group variable are not included in the plot.

Syntax: TRANSPARENCY= numeric-value 
          
Specifies the degree of transparency for the plot. The transparency that you specify applies to all 
aspects of the plot statement. For example, you can specify the amount of transparency applied to any 
displayed marker fills and marker outlines.

Default:0.0
Range:0 (completely opaque) to 1 (completely transparent)

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: SERIES X= variable Y= variable < / option(s)>; 
      
Creates a line plot.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: X= numeric-variable 
          
Specifies the variable for the X axis.

Syntax: Y= numeric-variable 
          
Specifies the variable for the Y axis.

Syntax: GROUP= variable 
          
Specifies a discrete variable that is used to group the data. SAS 9.4M6: The plot elements for each 
group value are automatically distinguished by different visual attributes. Each distinct group value 
is represented in the graph by a different line color. Line patterns are not changed across groups.

Syntax: LEGENDLABEL= "text-string" 
          
Specifies a label that identifies the plot in the legend. By default, the label 
of the Y variable is used.

Syntax: LINEATTRS= style-element (option(s))
          
Specifies the appearance of the series line attributes. The LINEATTRS= option is added to the SERIES 
statement of the SGMAP procedure.
          
(options) can be one or more of the following:

  COLOR= color 
  specifies the color of the line.

  PATTERN= line-pattern 
  specifies the line pattern for the line.

  THICKNESS= n <units> 
  specifies the thickness of the line. You can also specify the unit of measure. The default 
  unit is pixels (px).

Syntax: NAME="text-string"
          
Assigns a name to a line plot. You can use the name to refer to this plot in other statements.

Note:The text-string is case-sensitive and must define a unique name within the procedure. When you 
refer to this specified name in other statements within the SGMAP procedure, you must use the identical 
name.
Specifies that missing values of the group variable are not included in the plot.
Specifies that a smoothed line passes through all vertices.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: TEXT X=variable Y=variable TEXT=variable </option(s)>;
      
Displays the associated text values at (X, Y) locations in the graph. The text can be numbers or characters.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: X=variable
           
Specifies the variable for the X axis (longitude).

Syntax: Y=variable 
            
Specifies  the variable for the Y axis (latitude).

Syntax: TEXT=variable
          
Specifies the variable for the text values.

Specifies the position of the text with respect to the location of the data point.  

Default: CENTER

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Places the text at the bottom of the data point.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Places the text at the bottom left of the of the data point.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Places the text at the bottom right of the of the data point.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: Places the text on the left of the of the data point.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip5: Places the text on the right of the of the data point.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip6: Places the text at the top of the of the data point.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip7: Places the text at the top left of the of the data point.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip8: Places the text at the top right of the of the data point.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: TEXTATTRS=style-element | style-element (text-options) | (text-options)] 
          
Specifies the color and font properties of the marker text. Style elements are used to associate groups 
of appearance attributes with graph elements. The style attributes in use are COLOR, FONTFAMILY, FONTSIZE, 
FONTSTYLE, and FONTWEIGHT.

(text-options) 
COLOR=style-reference | color 
    specifies the color of the text. If you use a style-reference, the style-attribute should be a valid
    attribute such as COLOR, CONTRASTCOLOR, STARTCOLOR, NEUTRAL, ENDCOLOR. The convention is to use COLOR for text.
FAMILY=style-reference | "string" 
    specifies the font family of the text. If you use a style-reference, the style-attribute should be FONTFAMILY.
SIZE=style-reference | dimension 
    specifies the font size of the text. If you use a style-reference, the style-attribute should be FONTSIZE. 
STYLE=style-reference | NORMAL | ITALIC 
    specifies the font style of the text. If you use a style-reference, the style-attribute should be FONTSTYLE. 
WEIGHT=style-reference | NORMAL | BOLD 
    specifies the font weight of the text. If you use a style-reference, the style-attribute should be FONTWEIGHT.
